dcterms:description: MARS comprises 19680 tracklets from 6 different cameras, capturing 1260 different identities, with an average of 59 frames per tracklet. It has shown to be a challenging dataset due to automatic annotation leading to errors and false detections.
dcterms:title: MARS

dcterms:creator: Y. Wu
Y. Lin
X. Dong
Y. Yan
W. Ouyang
Y. Yang
dcterms:description: Duke is a dataset introduced for multi-target and multi-camera surveillance purposes, expanded to include person attributes and identities. The Duke-Video-ReID variant comprises 5534 video tracklets from 8 different cameras, with an average of 167 frames per tracklet.
dcterms:title: Duke

dcterms:creator: X. Liu
W. Liu
T. Mei
H. Ma
dcterms:description: VeRi-776 has been collected from 20 fixed cameras, capturing vehicles moving on a circular road in a 1.0 kmÂ² area. It contains 18397 tracklets with an average of 6 frames per tracklet, capturing 775 identities.
dcterms:title: VeRi-776

dcterms:creator: S. Li
J. Li
W. Lin
H. Tang
dcterms:description: The Amur Tiger Re-Identification in the Wild (ATRW) dataset includes 107 subjects with an average of 17.6 images per identity. It is designed for animal re-identification tasks.
dcterms:title: Amur Tiger Re-Identification in the Wild (ATRW)
